posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content: This blows my mind.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: Banned on every Online Server!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I dunno - I could say, "Ooh, impressive!", but I fear I'm more likely to say, "What a big fat waste of time."

Speed isn't always a good thing, you know.

Oh, and @eltalstro , congrats on getting revenge against us for the 1-day world cup in the 20-20 one. But what on earth went on in the final, mate? Still, not bad for a nation with a population of 53, of whom 30 play rugby and 22 cricket, with a prime minister just in case something happens!

Cheers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: If it is good, you want it to last.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: That is indeed impressive, but it is not for me.  It seems the goal of speedrunners is to skip as much of the game as possible, therefore enjoying it as little as possible.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Ah yes, the Vrock glitch for infinite XP...
If that is blowing your mind eltalstro, imagine how I felt back in 07' when the original Morrowind speedrun in 7 minutes was done...

And some people here confuse the speedrun with the enjoyment of the game, so let me explain to you how this works...
The people that have attempted (and therefore succeeded in the speedrun) have probably played the game a lot more than you, and I mean a lot more!

Personally, I enjoy speedruns but without glitches ;)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: This must be the ultimate form of meta gaming.
